intro: Calypso africana, commonly known as the African star orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, yellow, and green, which bloom during the rainy season. Calypso africana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for cultivation in gardens and greenhouses.
